Watermelon cocktail was good, I also enjoyed the brisket biscuit small plate. The broccoli soup was good, I prefer more cream based but it was still good. The rest of the party enjoyed their meals!

Always great service and delicious food! The bartenders here are TRUE mixologists!

Heather and Tommy are both incredible servers, knowledgable of the cocktail, wine and food menus. They will never hesitate to acquiesce any request, and they are sincerely two of the funniest servers that I have ever met. I enjoy every time I come to The House and they take care of me!

FYI- Steak tartare, foie gras, and scallops are incredible.

Food was excellent and service was perfect. Started out with the chicken thighs with crispy skin, just that dish would have been great for dinner. Pork chop was amazing, next time I am not sharing. Mac and cheese was superb, can't wait for more. Finally, the deserts were phenomenal, I wish all donuts and vanilla cake were that good. Luckily for me the wife was willing to share her desert. I will be back, and looking forward too brunch.

Unimpressive meal in an impressive setting.

Narrowed down our "special occasion" dining choice to Cafe Monarch and House Brasserie, with House Brasserie winning the coin toss.

Found the patio area to be very pleasant due in no small part to a perfect evening weather-wise without any need for the outdoor heaters.

Service was uniformly friendly and professional throughout the meal. Cocktails were expertly prepared.

Unfortunately, the most important element in our dining experience, the food, was disappointing.

Presentation was lackluster and in some cases the dishes tasted odd or were spoiled by distracting ingredients or were served luke-warm.

In the case of the smoked burrata appetizer, a lump of cow's milk cheese was placed alongside some toasted French bread slices, presentation one would expect at a much lower-end dining establishment. 

Why not place individual slices of cheese on their own crostini and garnish? The dish struck us as being very lazy.

The Tomahawk Pork Chop was smothered in some type of hard seeds. Imagine trying to enjoy one's meal, while removing tiny ball-bearings from between your teeth. It completely ruined the enjoyment of the dish.

The Lamb Bolognese had a decidely sour taste, so overpowering that it was left half-eaten by the two individuals who had ordered it as their entrees.

Finally, considering the cost, as well as the formal tone of House Brasserie's website, we were surprised at the number of families with toddlers as well as patrons who were comfortable dining in pajama bottoms and baseball caps.  

It was bad enough that we had suggested this restaurant to our friends. It would've been even more uncomfortable had this been one of our formal client dinners.

Absolutely the number 1 restaurant in Scottsdale for variety, flavor, service and ambiance!  We had the duck meatballs for appetizer, I had Scallops and my date ordered the Lamb.  All prepared with wonderful flavor!  Dessert we had the pineapple/caramel/pasticcio upside cake~~amazing! Their coffee is prepared table side in an aerated glass flask, fresh ground.  A real treat to experience.   We sat outside by the big fire place under the HUGE Pine tree, music was low an easy listening.  Our server, Ann, was a delight!  EVERY employee conducted themselves in a happy, professional manner & all sharped dressed in black.  Congratulations to Brian, owner, for another 1st class restaurant!

Having been warned about what to expect in Old Town Scottsdale, was completely taken aback to find The House, more Southern Charm and less Jersey Shore for sure! 

Plumpjack wine and fine whiskeys? But of course. Daily foie gras specials? NBD. Velvet wallpaper and candles everywhere? Duh.

Having visited SUR and PUMP recently in LA (both Vanderpump establishments), they should pay The House a visit for some tips on decorating and customer service. The House is more than a facade, they actually care about the customers - every customer, not just the "famous" ones. 

On Monday evening, the foie special was a gluttonous dessert dish of Brioche French toast, maple brown sugar butter and a generous piece of fatty duck liver on top. Each bite melted in my mouth. Very well executed.

The ambiance, the wine, the food make this brasserie tops on my list in Scottsdale. Upscale, but not pretentious. 5-stars.

Worst decision ever to change the brunch menu! Absolutely disappointing! No pork belly, no fried rice, and meat balls. Giant thumbs down on the menu change! The server is still uhh-mazing! Awesome vibe and awesome service!

I came here for a nice date night with my man. This place definitely lived up to the Yelp expectations. I am truly happy Yelp tool me to this gem. Now onto reviewing.

The concept of the restaurant is what kind of food you would get if you went to the Chef's house. This restaurant is 1 of 3 sister restaurants in the Valley. (The Mission and Zinc Bistro are the other two if that gives a good baseline for expectations)

The ambiance is very homey and classic. The inside has baroque wallpaper and chandwliera, and there ia an amazing patio, bigger than the inside dining area. This restaurant keeps the classic feel aince it is the second oldest house in the old town area. 

Now onto food.... 
I got the Lamb. It is a pasta with shredded lamb and a juicey sauce and spinach.  It was great mught have ruined all other pasta for me.
My bf got the rib eye. Medium rare and cooked to perfection. The whipped garlic was amazing and the best of the three sauces that it came with. 
On the side it brings some whipped pommes (fancy mashed potatoes for us common folk) they were great but if you are sharing.. I definitely recommend taking the pasta juice and adding it to the potatoes. Yum.

For dessert we got the Chocolate boudino which is a modern take on a smore. The cookies werent spectacular but the chocolate it self with nuts was great. 

Drinks get the express yourself. It has a nice kaluha kick. 
All in all.. thoroughly impressed. And had a great night.
Excellent food, service and crafted cocktails! The snapper and skirt steak were impeccable!!!
Cute restaurant with friendly staff. We had drinks and tasty apps but thought it was a pricey experience.

Went with the family (party of 8) for NYE dinner.   For appetizers we had the burrata, crispy chicken thigh, lobster gnocchi and foie gras.  The gnocchi was the standout dish.  Also had the tomato bisque (relatively spicy but we were not warned and one of the people who ordered could not eat it) followed by grouper, tomahawk pork chop, NY steak, scallops and lamb bolognese with roasted cauliflower, dungenes crab fried rice.  Had one of each dessert.  
Of the dishes I tasted the fried rice was my favorite. Chop was fair but we've had much better.   The other dishes were not bad but nothing stood out.
The big disappointment was the service.  Seemed like one of the servers was in training and the timing of various dishes was off (in particular, 1 of the soups we ordered arrived before the appetizers and the other one after).  Many other little faux pas that one would (should) not expect from a restaurant of this claimed caliber.  Our bill was $600 before tip so I expected something a little better than what we received.  
Am giving 3 stars because the meal wasn't a disaster and I don't know if I can do 2.5 stars.

This place was the absolute nuts. 

Amazing food, several attentive waiters for our table of 15 (which is a big deal because I usually feel like big parties are underserved), well priced wine. 

Potato appetizer was the highlight followed by the pork dish.  

Great place.  Highly recommend it when you want to spend a little something extra for a little something extra.

if this is the place i recall.. the sangria was way over priced for what it was.   wayyyyyyyy to much ice in it. and the waitress and waiter kept bringing more cups of ice to us.   then one tried to pour some in a cup of ice they brought us and i said ummm no thank you its watered down enough.. then they looked at me like i was crazy and questioned me again why i didnt want it poured in the ice.   was not worth the price whatsoever.  plus there was broken pieces of glass on our table that we kept showing the waitress.

Full review in the blog.  This place has potential, but thus far that potential is not fully realized.

seven plates, four desserts...and a $1 'bread supplement'

"Shrimp and Grits," a savory and intense composition of sweet and snappy head-on shrimp atop creamy popcorn grits enlivened by charred onions and smoky pork glaze with a touch on honey.  Sweet and savory but perhaps a bit steep at $14 this was a dish where the ingredients and the execution came together beautifully.

"Arizona Ricotta, Sicilian Pistachio Toast, Roasted Radish" at $8 arrived as a trio with only a single flaw - a dearth of salt to liven up the otherwise beautifully cooked radish.  A bit of a disappointment even despite the high quality of the tender taproot the dish certainly improved in moving on to the bread crisps as the ricotta was ever so slightly melted while the bread itself was herbal and crunchy but at the same time subtle.  With a bit more salt this one could be great.

For Duck Confit Meatballs, Foie Gras, White Bean, Tomato Agrodolce it would be hard to say exactly how/why such decadent ingredients did not live up to my expectations, particularly as the meatballs were tender and rife with flavor, but if I had to pin it on one thing I think it would be the expectations arising with the word "Foie Gras" and the $14 price tag as the sapor of the foie was largely lost to the tomatoes while the puree of white bean was okay, but mostly just filler.

Berkshire Pork Belly, Kimchee, Udon Noodle, Fried Egg arrived with some joking at the table about the ubiquity of pork belly these days and as much as I cannot argue that said ingredient is delicious I just didn't find it well utilized here as the fattiness of the swine simply overwhelmed any semblance of kimchee while the noodles were soggy and limp.  Decent flavors though garnished by a rather inconsequential egg I had a few bites and that was enough.

"Maine Lobster Fried Rice, Mullet Egg, Aji Amarillo" was actually a rather nice plate of risotto with a lot of umami and a touch of heat but "fried rice" it most certainly was not.  Nice enough, but certainly not a sharable plate, one of my tablemates summed it up perfectly when he commented that all this dish really did was make him want to go elsewhere and get a dish of "kick ass" fried rice - something he could have done at 1/3 the tab and had enough for lunch the next day.

Moving last to a pair of sides, each $6 and far more generous than the rice, Grilled and Buttered Shiitake Mushrooms, Truffle Honey along with Grilled Broccoli Carbonara, Pancetta, Egg, Black Pepper arrived and where the first showed strongly in its simplicity the second fell flat once again due to a lack of salt - a lack so pronounced that frozen broccoli straight from the bag has more flavor thus making me wonder exactly what sort of pancetta was even present.

Buttermilk Blackberry Crumb Cake arrived as a dense butter cake with a downhome toothsomeness that I really enjoyed, but with ample notes of buttermilk dominating the sweetness of the berries I think this one could have benefitted from one of two things - a dollop of ice cream or a cup of coffee.  I'd definitely order this as a breakfast item anywhere.

Caramel Apple Upside Down Cake, Salted Caramel, and Pistachio Ice Cream.  A long and linear presentation with the apple flavor a bit overwhelmed by the salty caramel but still potent and tart what truly made this plate shine was the ice cream - creamy, rich, and rife with nutty flavor...had we been dining earlier I'd have probably driven over to Sweet Republic for another round.

Under other circumstances Sacher Torte would have been the highlight of the meal and served with "Toasted Almond Amaretto Mascarpone Mousse" this one was a fine example.  Dense, intensely cocoa, and appropriately dry without suffering the Americanization of making it too birthday-cake in texture this was another dessert that would have gone great with coffee but the use of the mousse and bold apricot flavor kept everything balanced and bright.  It was awesome.

If there is one thing The House should keep doing from this point until the day they close their doors it should be keeping the Butterscotch Pudding on the menu.  A fan of all puddings - from rice to bread to budino - and having had a number of similar presentations elsewhere this version was simply outstanding - sweet and salty, dense and creamy, and bespeckled with chocolate and fruit adding both texture and flavor.  It goes on the short list for Phoenix's best desserts and will likely remain there for some time.

Overall, The House is off to a decent start but still has a lot of room for growth in every department except perhaps dessert and d√©cor.  A lovely setting already with great service I think the focus should start with improved seasoning and working to nail the basics before experimenting with 'fusion' and once the kitchen is hitting on all cylinders perhaps improving the portion/price ratio.

House Brasserie, you're such a flirt. You weren't even modest about it, you flaunted that sensuality before I reached for the door, tarted up in your tinkling necklace of lights and gown of vine. I have to admit, I was smitten. For a dame of such established pedigree (I hear you're the second eldest home in all of Scottsdale), you're Rita Hayworth, Katharine Hepburn and Grace Kelly wrapped in kale and orecchiette: divine.

You titillated me with your silken, endlessly long crab legs, lime buttered above the heel. I wanted to peel and eat your spicy shrimp, but that would've been a little too adventurous for a first date, so I... chowed down. Immediately I cooled my fiery palate with your amazing kale salad, something we both agreed was both delectable and smart from a dietary perspective. But oh, how our sensibilities were fast to wane as you prepared cocktail after fabulous cocktail...

Your Chateau Briand, oh my! Delectable. Lobster Friend Rice: it's an Asian fusion love affair! Broccoli Carbonarra: you have me at your doorstep. Marinated Jidori Chicken: I'm swimming in your silk sheets. So get it over with already, Brasserie. Take me.

You did. I feel like such a floozy. Your crumb cake and sacher torte made me your slave. I'm done. I don't want to talk about it anymore. I feel used.

And I WANT MORE.

Don't get me started on your wallpaper...

My husband surprised me for my Birthday and took me here. We sat at a special table right in front of the fireplace, It was very romantic! The service was impeccable, we were treated very well. Not only was our waitress amazing, so was the rest of the staff. 

The Food was even more amazing. I had the scallops with grits, and my husband had the 20oz Ribeye with horseradish mash potatoes. For our sides we had the fried rice, cauliflower, and the macaroni and cheese (each had a delicious unique flavor). For dessert we shared the donuts, they had a perfect crispy outside with a delicious fluffy inside. The sauces that accompanied the donuts were a perfect match. I highly suggest this restaurant for a date night or a night out with friends.

All around excellent dining experience made for a perfect date night!
From the friendly valet across the street to the attentive waitstaff and the friendly host, all were just terrific.
The food was excellent. The chef masterfully combined an eclectic array of ingredients to create flavor masterpieces. I personally loved that the chef was daring to push the spice limit... I enjoyed my Creekstone filet. finally something with flavor and heat. Not another safe, bland and boring steak dish!
Awesome job!

The most amazing restaurant! The food and the ambiance is impeccable. The restaurant is stunningly beautiful. The farrow salad was so good.  My fianc√© raved about the brisket on a brisket he said the creamy cheese on top is heavenly.  Can't wait to go back!

Stop what you're doing!!!!!

If you are the type of person that only reads the 5 star reviews then you get what you deserve. Like we did on this one. Should have went more with the Google reviews which had it closer to 3 stars.

Not sure what they are thinking here with all these flavors and weird dishes but they don't work!

Add chopped onions to the Mac and cheese? Why?

Huge pieces of Lemon Peel on top of the Short Rib? Why??

Deconstructed Lobster Bisque? Weird and no one seemed to be a fan.

At the end of the day you just have to ask yourself if you'd order any of the things you've ordered, again. The answer was a resounding NO.

Even the mixed drinks were weird.

Not to mention the prices. Just retarded

Delightful food in a magical setting.  I suggest going at night when the lights and candles are flickering.  Eat outside.  The food is fantastic.  The only thing we did not like was the shiitake mushrooms.  They were "too" smokey.  Worth the money.

Hands down one of the most consistent yet unique, romantic dining spots in Greater Phoenix. Many visits, never disappointed, and more than once service WAY beyond expectations .  Literally an impromptu tasting when it was an otherwise slow summer night, and another night the pressed clean shirt straight from the GM, when I blew it with my red wine covering my white shirt, was beyond belief. My fault and yet they somehow still made it an amazing experience without embarrassing me one iota. That's class. That's service. And it's innovative 5-star food on top of that!

We visited the restaurant during Restauant Week and we're not given a menu for their Rest. Week options. When we asked our waiter, he said they were out of many items and he could pare items from the regular menu much better. He tried to push an expensive bottle of wine and when we requested another option, they were out of it or he wasn't happy with our choice because it was $30 less than the bottle he choose. My husband asked for fries with his dinner, which we were told they were out of- seriously how are you out of fries at 6:30 on a Saturday? So my husband choose another option - fingerling potatoes. We were almost finished with our meal, which was average, and guess what was delivered to the table next to ours, fries. When we asked our waiter if they suddenly got an order of fries, he had no response. Another waiter came over and explained that the only way you could get fries was with the steak tartare and that 'he wished he could control the kitchen'. We were so irritated that we left, leaving a 1/4 bottle of wine and went to another restaurant for a drink. They need to train their staff and order more supplies if this restaurant wants to stay in business. There are too many good restaurants in Scottsdale to deal with that.

Had the most amazing brunch on Mothers Day.  The lady who wrote a book about her experience has way too much time on her hands.  The wait staff was excellent. The scrambled eggs with prosciutto and blue berry banana French toast was to die for. Unlimited mimosa and the beautiful bottle of chianti as a gift was a plus.  The goat cheese cake put us over the top. Can't wait to return. It's my new favorite neighborhood restaurant - and we have a lot of them in Old Town. The ambiance was just as fun as the food. See you back soon.

Service is friendly and laid back. The cocktails are pretty good. The food was just ok. I am not familiar with Matt Carter, but from what I've heard I was expecting a little more. The Smoked Burrata was under salted. The Pork Belly and Udon noodles were confusing, I couldn't tell what that dish was supposed to be. The pork belly was tender and delicious on its own but with the noodles, it was a strange and unapproachable dish with too many conflicting flavors. The Farro salad had a lot of grapefruit flavor. We liked the pistachio ice cream, however the butterscotch pudding tasted like it was made from a box of instant pudding. 

It was strange being able to stare at the busser station the whole time. It was slightly messy and unkempt. 

When we first sat down the music they had playing was techno. It felt out of place. However by the time we had our dessert there was light jazz playing. 

Overall, I wasn't blown away by anything. 

I'm excited to see what Chef Carter is capable of in the future. As for now, I'm still a little lost trying to interpret his cuisine at The House.

The hubby and I decided to try this place for date night.  We are relatively new to town and hit a home run with this restaurant.  When making a reservation online I requested a booth and mentioned that I was pregnant.  We were seated as requested and our server bent over backwards to make sure he was aware of any and all food restrictions I had.  The food was all delicious.  We had the st. Andre cheese (my favorite) and the brisket and biscuits as well as the rib eye.  My hubby indulged in a glass of red and just for fun we split the chocolate dessert.  It was a deconstructed s'more and was melt in your mouth yummy.  The service was spectacular, we were checked on often and never wanted for anything.  The food was worth the price and the ambience was wonderful.  Overall a fantastic date night and we can't wait to return (and try the executive chefs other restaurants).

I love trying new restaurants, and was so happy that my husband chose this gem to celebrate my birthday last evening. We were greeted immediately and sat in a beautiful corner booth. The ambiance is romantic, and I can't wait for the weather to cool off so I can sit outside next time.  The place is upscale, but you can dress in jeans and some heals and still fit in fine. I have no other words except sensational! If food sex is a thing, then House Brasserie is my new boyfriend. My server made me feel special and immediately offered me champaign for my birthday when he asked what we were celebrating. I opted for a martini, as it was a long day! My ONLY feedback is to get some martini glasses, as they served it in a margarita glass. But the drink was just the right amount of dirty!  We started with 2 small plates: Smoked Burrata and Frois Gras....If the meal ended there I would have still been happy. For the main we ordered the Jidori Chicken and the Filet, and shared. As sides we got fries and the lobster rice. You could cut the fillet with a fork, seriously my husband did it without using his knife.  But the chicken stole the show. It had an incredible flavor that couldn't be topped. The flavors of every dish we tried burst in our mouths. I could not have had a better meal at any other restaurant. I was actually mad at my husband for making me wait till 8:30 for dinner because we couldn't get a reservation earlier, but if I had to go back at 3 am to taste this wonderful food again, I would do it!  I closed the evening with a great glass of Rose' and a complimentary Creme Brule' which happens to be my favorite dessert. The simple details like the sliced strawberries on my desert were the freshest I have ever tasted. Find a way to dine here, you will not regret it! Thank you House Brasserie for a wonderful evening! We will be back!

This place magically combines French charm with comfort. Their dining room is dripping in French d√©cor, but, the air of casualness is hard to miss. Love that they fuss over the food rather than you. 

The small plates were delectable. The duck confit meat balls (who would have thought, right?) set the bar high, and, everything that followed matched up to it; especially, the luscious crab fondue. 

Service, while attentive, was non intrusive. No mundane "how's everything?" while drifting across the room to the next table. The questions were genuine, and, they patiently heard us out and added to what we had to say without hijacking too much of our time.

The party poopers were the desserts and the $100 bill for two. I know. I know. Good food is always worth the money, but, I am not sure I will (can?) go back often with the hefty price tag. However, I will go back as often as I can afford to!

I hosted a bridal shower brunch for my friend here and it was a wonderful experience.  The staff made the entire event incredibly easy to plan and they went out of their way to make it a special day for my friend.  Everyone loved the food and the atmosphere and the prices were very reasonable for what you got.  Thanks again!

3.5 to be fair !!!

Okay this place is hands down super trendy and romantic and just adorable inside ( I love all the mirrors). We had two mishaps without food being undercooked...they fixed both without giving us any grief and were very nice about the whole situation. Our service was great overall and they definitely made up for the food situation. 

We tried quite a few things- the kale salad is flippen fantastic. I'm not a huge meat eater so i was happy with the kale salad and brie potatoes we got also. My dear bf is the meat lover out of us and he was disappointed a little with the pork he got but said he would like to go back and try again so it was not alllll the bad.

The desserts were sinful and delicious and paired well with some shots of peppermint schnapps :)

I want my star rating to go up so we will give it another go around in the near future...there is definite potential to be found at The House Brasserie.

This was my second time there for a drink.  Haven't eaten there yet. The place is an old residence, hence the name "The House." It is very cozy and homy and has a very inviting bar.  The bartenders have been very friendly and service minded.  My fianc√©e  asked for a shot of Tequila and one of the bartenders (female, who also turned out to be the manager) recommended a brand she swore by.  Little did we know that a shot was $15.00, however after we complained she comped the shot and apologized for the situation.

We were excited to come here.   Friends did say it was fantastic.   Our experience was different.   Food was average at best.  Wife got the grouper and didn't care for it.  I got the lobster gnocchi and it was a bit salty. I also ordered the tomahawk porkchop.  It was burnt to a char on the outside.  Smoked Manhattan was average.  I've had better drinks at other places.  The dessert menu was uninspiring.  We ended up going to hillstone for their sundae.  Service was average.  Our meal was $150, and at that price point there are a lot of better options such as any Hillstone restaurant, Virtu, Monarch Cafe, Elements and Olive & Ivy to name a few.  I wanted to like this place.  If you're debating on a place to go, House Brasserie would not be my first choice.

Old fashioned and manhattan were both delicious and boozy.  Sat at the bar. Ambience both inside and outside were fantastic.  Trees around you and lots of hanging lights.  Inside reminded me of back east 1950s; very elegant and classic.  Service was fantastic as well.
Yummy! Loved the bartender. Loved the food (chef trained at French Laundry). Great ambiance. If your looking for history this is your spot house built in '37.

I was in town for Spring Training with my boyfriend so we are unfamiliar with the area and going off of pure Yelp reviews without some friend recommendations made us nervous. We finally zoned in on The House Brasserie because of its variety of food beyond just steak like many other nice restaurants in the area.

The food did not disappoint and prices/portions were totally reasonable. I'm from the SF Bay Area where there is no good shortage of food but I would say THB is on par with all the nice restaurants in SF.

We started off with cocktails - Green Lantern for me (gin, lime, honey dew, and other flavors) and a Roiboos whiskey drink for the bf. Both were great, I think the green lantern is one of my favorite gin cocktails I've tried thus far. 

Apps- Thick-cut bacon and Foie Gras. FG was paired as a charcuterie plate with almonds, mustard, pickles, daikon radishes, and some other pairings and seared to perfection and nicely seasoned. Thick-cut bacon was tasty but had the texture of pork belly instead of bacon.

Main Dishes- Ribeye for the bf and Duck Bolognese for me. Both were awesome dishes and we agreed they were 5-star worthy. Neither dish was overcooked or over-seasoned. We also ordered mushrooms and basil+brie fingerling potatoes as sides. 

Dessert- Because I let them know it was my boyfriend's birthday, they took care of dessert and brought out a deconstructed vanilla bean goat cheese cheesecake with reduced strawberries, coconut crust crumble, mint, honey lavender. I don't usually like cheesecake but I have to say this is the best cheesecake and one of the best desserts I've ever had. They also brought out two glasses of complimentary champagne which was a nice touch.

Overall- Service was above and beyond my expectations and the food was delicious. Total bill was just under $150 before tax, and that's including 2 cocktails and a generous amount of food! There is outdoor and indoor seating available, but choose outdoor seating if you want a quieter romantic setting. They have heat lamps and extra blankets in case it's cold out.

Thank you House Brasserie for making my boyfriend's birthday dinner experience and our sole fine-dining experience in Scottsdale a memorable one!

Already loved this place before tonight but after trying their smoked Manhattan cocktail - I'm putting it on my list of "Safe spots to send your friends to and not worry about looking like a jackass"..  As soon as my group walked into the bar we were greeted by the bartender (Kenny I think is his name). He made our Manhattan's to perfection and treated my douchebag friends with undeserving respect.  The food menu is also amazing, I have had it several times and it never disappoints.
Food is amazing, the patio is even better. Anniversary brunch by the fire and even allowed us to bring our large dog.

Charming place, extensive wine list including wines offered by the bottle can also be requested by the glass ( so many good choices !!). I enjoyed the red snapper for dinner and roasted cauliflower. The service was excellent. All staff including the manager were attentive, friendly and social. The restaurant appeared to be short staffed so there were a few minor glitches but overall a delicious and extremely enjoyable dining experience. I would absolutely return!

I came here once when they first opened up and liked it. The hubby and I decided to come here for a romantic date night and we where happy we did. Everything we ordered was fantastic, delicious, and fresh.
We first had the lobster gnocchi...WOW!! Big, chunky fresh pieces of lobster mixed in with their home made gnocchi. 
Second, we had the foie gras. This is the best Foie Gras I have tasted so far. The serving was only 1oz, but worth every succulent bite. I was not a fan of the sauce they added on the side. I like the Foie Gras flavors to shine through.
Lastly, we ordered the Filet with Brabb. Yumm Yumm Yumm!!
I cannot wait to come back and try more of their delicious plates on the menu.

Thank you!!!

We enjoyed our dinner.  It was exceptional.  Remember you are paying for exquisite dining, not big portions.  (if that is your intent go to Claim Jumper :( )

I've seen several comments on the service.  I would like to note something extraordinary happened.  We were introduced to our server who was going to be right back when another one of her tables broke a glass of wine and she had to attend to them.  Within a matter of minutes another server took over for her and we were not left waiting while the first waitress assisted the other patrons with resetting their table.  Personally I see a lot of merit and selflessness in this which is indicative of an establishment that focuses on the needs of the customer.  So whatever other negative comments there may be on service I'd like to counter that ours was a positive experience.  Thank you Ashley, you were a great server.

The dining experience and quality were as expected for a high end establishment so we were not let down and very satisfied.  We had the scallops, fillet, mac & cheese, Dungeness crab fried rice and (for fun) the crinkle cut fries.  Everything was great but the crab fried rice was mildly spicier than expected and we wished there was more of a crab taste and an indication of crab pieces.

The ambiance was wonderful both inside and outside.

The bar - THIS is what a bar should look like.  I want to go back just to sit and have a drink at the bar it was so classy.

Also, they are experimenting with fixed courses and wine pairing which are limited to a few number of people each night.  The table we saw that opted for this dinner looked like they were having lots of fun and the manager and chef came out and engaged with the table often.  I suggest you splurge for this at the extra cost and enjoy it yourself. 

We will be back.

Went here for my BF's birthday, and everything from the ambiance to the service to the food was nothing short of amazing. We had the smoked manhattans with the crispy chicken thighs (amazing also) and they are so good. The twist of the smoke with the cherry coke was delicious and unexpected. We loved them. We then switched to wine, which the waiter recommended a bottle and it was awesome (again!). My bf had the lamb and they were cooked so well, so tender and juicy. I had the Halibut, so good! the veggies on the plate and the mushrooms were so well done. We then ended with complimentary dessert which was unreal- Whipped Ricotta and Poppy seed with sweet berry compote. YUM! Just go here - everything is so well done, you can't be disappointed.

Flexible with reservation and the place was packed.  Good atmosphere and diverse crowd.   Menu is amazing with great options for "small plates"/appetizers.  Main courses were also like looking at multiple different nice restaurants. Incredible range that makes me want to go back tommorrow. Reasonably priced food for the quality that's served.   Attentive staff, including the hostess that had the most drinks in the entire place.

Ok, I am high maintenance and very picky!!!!! Saying that, This place passed the test!!!! Everything about it was over the top!!! It is pricy but so worth it!  If you are about the price this is NOT your place.  Love this place!!!! Top notch all the way!!!!

Another impressive accomplishment from the team responsible for The Mission and Zinc Bistro.

In consistent form, House Brasserie is a unique and enjoyable dining experience.  The eclectic light fixtures and wallpaper establish a feel of elegance that is both comfortable and approachable.  The menu delivers creativity and variety with a number of small plates that are perfect for sharing. The cocktail list is fun balancing some familiar classics with a few innovative options as well.

The difference between good and great often lies in the details, and once again those are well attended to at House Brasserie.

Enjoy.

Beautiful decorations, cozy mood lighting, and a comfortable layout make this a perfect place for a romantic evening

The waitstaff are friendly and knowledgeable. The shared plates are a must: amazing brussels sprouts, delectable cheeses, and incredible cauliflower.

The main plates were delicious as well, although vegetarians will need to look elsewhere since everything has meat or fish. Or perhaps just stick to more delicious shared plates, of which several are vegetarian.

The drinks were tasty, although all at our table questioned if there was much alcohol in them. They definitely seemed lacking in strength

Entree prices are high but you get great food. Handmade pastas, high quality meats, and wonderful decor.

Looking forward to coming back again sometime when I visit AZ again

Took my girlfriend here and was not disappointed. Staff showed an immense amount service. Establishment has an exceptional atmosphere and is even better under the night sky. I ordered the lamb bolognese and a kale salad. Both dishes were very good and hopefully on some other special occasion I will return.

I went to this restaurant last night as part of the BF and I's V day date exchange. This restaurant had some extreme highs and some middling points. 

The highs:

-House made cinnamon whiskey and the whiskey apple.....I don't even like whiskey and I love this!
-Our waiter, Tommy, was awesome, helpful, and honest
-Brisket biscuit..... tiny, but packed a lot of flavor, the meat was tender and the sauce was tangy...just delicious.
-Broccoli carbonara....not healthy in the least.... so delicious, creamy and cheesy sauce over perfectly cooked broccoli. 
-Apple caramel upside down cake - this cake is phenomenal.... the perfect amount of sweetness and the pairing of the pistachio ice cream is just wonderful. 
-Popcorn grits....extremely tasty, Definitely will get this as a side next time (got it with the pork this time). 


The Middling points: 

-We were seated right next to the door to the restaurant on the patio, which was ok....but it was a very high traffic area next to the waiting area/lounge thing and it was cold out and this particular table was not near a heater or a fire....not awesome. (and yes, we made reservations a week ahead of time)
- The pork entree was pretty mediocre....pork should be extremely delicious, but this pork was just lacking flavor. The portion size was big, but that doesn't matter if it's not something you really would like to eat. 
-The goodnight kiss drink was just alright....it had chantilly cream in it, which sounded amazing, but in reality made the drink just a bit too thick and heavy to be very enjoyable. 


Overall, the night was nice, the food was good, and I would definitely return, but next time I might stick with sides, apps, drinks, and desserts (with an emphasis on dessert...yum).

Brunch started off well. The restaurant was incredibly cute with the feeling of walking into a cozy cottage decorated with flowers. Seemed like a great place for a bridal shower or girl's brunch. However, things quickly went downhill from there. 

This establishment is operated by the same owners as The Mission which we went to the night before and all thought it was fantastic. Therefore, I'd like to assume that our experience was a one-off disappointment, however, I don't think any of us will be back to Phoenix for a while (all east-coasters) to actually prove that. 

The restaurant was 90% empty when we arrived for our 1PM reservation. However, it still took them 15 minutes to bring us water and ask for our orders. We had to wait an additional 10 minutes for our drinks to appear. We had mentioned to them that we had a time constraint so please rush our food and drinks, however, it didn't seem that was taken into consideration. I would understand if the restaurant was crowded but it was majorly empty. When the food finally did come out, they forgot my meal and had to go back and search for it. 

We were given a full menu to look over and were not told that only the brunch menu (on the last page) would be served. There is NOTHING worse than getting a menu, picking something you think sounds delicious, having your mind set on it, and then being told it is not available. If they are only intending on serving their brunch menu, generally restaurants only hand out their brunch menu during brunch. At the VERY least, we could have been told to disregard the 5 other pages of menu options prior to being seated. 

The food was average and the pricing was also average for the area (but not for the service). We would have probably been a better eating experience if the service was at a higher level. We were all looking forward to a great Scottsdale brunch experience and left feeling very disappointed and, quite frankly, annoyed.
This place is fantastic, been there twice and going again today.  The brunch   selections are perfect, service  is amazing and the decor is beautiful.

So my girlfriend and I decided to go out for girls night and check out this new spot for dinner. We had no idea what to expect as we had never seen the place before, but we knew it had to be good if it was anything like the mission. Well it was so much more than that! It was the cutest little place set in an old historic house with a charming candelight patio and the hugest tree I had ever seen sprawling over the place! 

We were greated and told a bit about the menu and drinks after we were sat outside in front of the lovely old fireplace. I chose the watermelon cooler and my friend went with a margarita of some kind. OMG those drinks were to die for!!! the watermelon cooler was so so good and I could have drank that all night! We then decided to share a few things for small plates. We ordered the brisket biscut which just melted in your mouth and was packed with flavor! We then had the crab dip which was absolutely delicious and creamy and the bread was toasted to perfection. Then our absolute favorite was the duck confit meatballs. These were thee best meatballs ever! Crispy on the outside soft on the inside and there was a serious explosion of flavors that I cannot even describe!

It was so good we went for brunch the next day and let me tell you that was amazing as well. Do yourself a favor and treat your palate at the House Brasserie!

Was blown away by everything. The food was was incredible, service was excellent, the decor was very plush, and the atmosphere was energetic. Highly recommend for a date spot. Can not go wrong. Everything on the menu I and my girlfriend tried was really, really good. We eat out a lot where ever my job travels me too and this is a have to if you are in the Phoenix Area.

I recently had my wife's birthday party at The House.   We had 30 people dining with us.  The setting was beautiful.  I was worried the night might be a little chilly to dine outside as it was in the 40's, but the tents combined with heaters kept the temperature very comfortable.  We had the heaters running well below full blast as it was getting too warm. Sitting out on the patio with the fireplace going made the event feel even more festive.
How did it all go? First, the good:  Sonia, the events manager was very responsive and helpful.  She delivered exactly what was promised.  The food was very good.  I had skirt steak which was well seasoned and had delicious accoutrements.  My wife's swordfish was also excellent.  Cocktails were delicious and wine was fairly priced.  Next the better: the service.  It was just about perfect.  The servers were very friendly.  We were well attended with respect to drinks and orders and the food came out efficiently around the table.  I had a cake delivered earlier in the day which they kept and plated for a nominal fee.  The bad: I can't think of a thing.  The House really knocked it out of the park.  My wife had an amazing time.  I wouldn't hesitate to have an event there again in the future.
Perfect!  Great food, great ambiance, great drinks. My only complaint is that people seem to be catching on and it is getting busy.

A very nice find slightly off the beaten path in old town Scottsdale.  In a town overrun by big name steakhouses or wanna be trendsetters, this is an effective demonstration of vintage cuisine.  

Sure, I had the ribeye, but our party of 16 sampled most of what is on the menu.  The foie gras app is excellent (tough to mess that up, I know).  

Next time, I promise to order an entree that is more French!

I've been here twice and had two different experiences. 

The first was five star. The waiter told us the history of the restaurant and the inspiration behind their food. He made great recommendations on food and wine pairings. The lobster gnocchi appetizer melts in your mouth, the gnocchi are like soft pillows and the sweet lobster balances perfectly with the truffle. 

The second visit was on New Years Eve. While I will visit this restaurant again I will never be back on New Years Eve. We did have a party of 8 which I know can be difficult. The full menu was offered which was nice but it made the evening very slow. We were often forgotten about, waiting for food with empty drinks. Appetizers came out staggered with one completely forgotten. We waited an hour for appetizers and our dinner order had yet to be taken. After ordering dinner it took 75 minutes to arrive. At 45 minutes our waitress said it was just getting plated, at 60 minutes she came back and said the EXACT same thing. I mentioned she had said that before and she admitted she knew it was taking a long time and apologized. A bottle of wine was comped but overall the service was unacceptable. 

The food was excellent when it arrived. The tartare had the perfect amount of acid, gnocchi was as great as I remembered, the fries were salty and crispy, lamb bolognese was tender, someone said their filet was one of the best ones they've had in awhile and the pork chops were  massive but looked delicious and raved about. 

While New Years was disappointing, I get it. If they were to offer a set menu I think the timing would have been better/easier for the kitchen and staff. I'll keep this place on the list for date nights and intimate dinners with friends.

Everything about this experience was so spot-on. Every single person on staff was friendly, warm, and helpful. The food was perfection: creative, tasty, unpretentious. Both the indoor and outdoor seating is gorgeous and heavy on the ambiance (in a good way). 
We started with the lamb&foie gras meatballs (oh, how far I've fallen from meatless diet) and the brisket + biscuit (I'm a sucker for a good rhyme). Both were incredible, and turned out to be a fair indication of what was to follow. Collectively, we ordered the streak, the lamb pasta, and the scallops. SCALLOPS FTW. Everything was beautiful and tasty, but the scallops really took it home. 
As for drinks, don't leave here without trying their house made cinnamon whiskey. My parents loved it so much that they're still drunk as I type this. Additionally, I ordered a Pimms Mule and my mom had a Cosmo, both of which were expertly crafted and delicious. 
If you're in Scottsdale and looking for an intimate setting with exquisite food, don't hesitate to make a reservation here (but seriously, make a reservation because this place is always poppin').

Had a great dinner in their very nice outdoor patio/garden.  Food was good and our server Richie was fantastic; had great suggestions for food and drinks and elevated the whole experience.  Definitely will be coming back and requesting Richie's section!

A perfect experience!...

I helped organize a corporate dinner at The House Brasserie last night, and our entire experience could not have been any better! Every attendee--many who were from outside the US--had extremely positive remarks about the evening's experience. In other words: SUCCESS! The ambiance was beautiful, the food was extraordinary, and the service likewise outstanding.

Our group of 40+ was seated in the large, brick-paved patio area out front. The tables were arranged with thoughtful intentionality so as to make our group as comfortable as possible in the beautiful space. The lights, house music, table decor, and gorgeous weather all added to the delightful environment. 

When our group arrived we were greeted by servers ready with fresh drinks, hot appetizers, and smiling faces. And as the next three courses were delivered one-after-the-other with precision timing throughout the evening (props to the kitchen staff!), our taste buds danced with each exquisite plate as we anxiously awaited the next round of mouth-watering goodness. 

And as awesome as the ambiance and food were, the overall service completely tied it all together. The management staff were present, hands-on, and willing to bend over backward to ensure everything was perfect for us. The servers were warm and authentically friendly all night long. The bussers were helpful, timely, and unobtrusive. You could tell that the team had been well trained due to the high standard of professionalism from everyone there.  

From an event planner's perspective, I can't wait for the next time I will have the privilege to work with the team at The House again. While we were originally planning to hold our event at a different nearby restaurant, I'm so happy we changed our plans to spend the evening at The House. Sonia, Brian, Jimmy, Chef Matt, Sarah, and ALL of the staff were amazing to work with. They were personable and professional. They said YES more than no. They sought to accommodate us in every feasible way. And those things matter to me as a customer. From the first site visit I did with Sonia months before our event, it was clear that she and the team are top-notch professionals who endeavor to deliver the best possible experience for their patrons. Two thumbs, three cheers, and five stars for The House Brasserie!

This place is amazing! I was there for a work dinner and the atmosphere, staff, and food were incredible! The owner was right outside and asked what we though as we left and it was definitely worth every penny!! Perfect date night spot also. Can't wait to go back!
Came for Sunday brunch, was blown away by the beautiful patio!! Duck chilechiles were awesome and half price bottles of wine is never a bad thing!!

Every part of The House Brasserie is exceptional!  The food, drinks, service and atmosphere are truly a cut above the rest!  Whether you are going for date night, drinks with the girls or needing to impress someone in your professional life this is the place!  I highly recommend the crab and Gouda fondue to start!  For dinner you must try the Lamb Bolognese (order the bread and butter though to soak up the extra sauce) and don't pass up a side of lobster fried rice for the table to share!  My friend ordered the country rib dish and again just delicious!  When it's time for dessert you can't go wrong with any of them but I must say the caramel apple upside cake is was SO yummy!  I will definitely be back!

Wanted to love it as I love Mission. The ambiance is beautiful & loved that the owner came up to the table to see how we were doing.  The food was good.  They obviously are still working out the kinks, but I have to say that the service needs to be better.  There were four of us at the table & we were doing a sort of tapas evening - ordering several items & sharing so we asked our waiter several times if one order of each appetizer was good for four (duck meatballs, shrimp, brisket biscuits) - since we all wanted to try each one - imagine our dismay when they all came out with three pieces each, so I never got to taste some of them.  We would have ordered more if we had known - the wait staff should be instructed to advise people as to how many pieces come in each dish so the customers can make informed decisions.  Many restaurants I go to back home, in NYC, will advise you as to how many pieces are in a dish & will offer to add to the original amount for a little extra - we have no problem paying for additional pieces so it would be to the restaurant's advantage to just let people know.  We all left there still hungry.  I'd go back & give it another try based on how much I love Mission and how beautiful the place itself is.

My boyfriend surprised me with a birthday dinner here.  This restaurant made my night so special and memorable.  Not only was the food amazing (SERIOUSLY AMAZING), the staff was beyond attentive, helpful, and funny!  I can't speak highly enough about this place... although I might be a little biased since I had such an amazing night here with my boyfriend.

I had the Creekstone fillet with the brussels. As I like my steaks cooked Pittsburgh with a cold rare center, it's not easy for most restaurants to make me happy, but the chef did an excellent job. The waitress was friendly and the overall noise was not overwhelming .I would definitely go back.

p.s. Definitely try the bread and butter appetizer. I don't know how they could do such a good job of making great bread.

One of the best new restaurants I've been to in a while. A converted 1940s-ish Scottsdale home, this place has the Best ambiance--especially the outdoor patio. The brisket appetizer is amazing. I had the scallops for the entree and it was fantastic. Can't wait to return!

After trying to get a reservation for a month or so we finally got one!!  6 of us sat outside and celebrated my mom's birthday. The atmosphere was excellent. The hostess was delightful. The bartender was very nice. Our waiter was nice, but a bit over the top. He used several of his "lines" on all the tables around us. The chef sent out a little complimentary appetizer that was to die for. We ordered the chicken meatballs, brisket, steak, chicken, pork chop, potatoes and more. Every single dish was delish but sadly, not hot enough. We were all slightly disappointed that the food was not hotter.  We had to ask for dessert menus (after waiting awhile) and the desserts were not nearly as good as the dinner. Stick with appetizers, forget about dessert!

Great food, and perfectly portioned. Good atmosphere (especially out front), good music, good people. It is a bit of a mix of modern and traditional, hard to explain, but my parents and I really liked it. The service was a little too slow at times, but everything else was great.
